intro: Pycreus puncticulatus, commonly known as the punctuated pycreus, is a lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and somewhat obscure botanical specimen.
